Description: Body sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black with two added white bands at top and possibly a third at bottom of sherd; exterior: painted decoration consisting of goose (neck, chest and part of one wing remaining) to right; at right, part of large floral pattern; part of dotted rosette as filling ornament.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 251, no. 380, pl. 55)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0143) (phase 2)
